top_categories.workout_context: Opelika Okey Dokey rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Opelika Okey Dokey’s rolling gravel, rural alabama demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Opelika Okey Dokey isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Opelika Okey Dokey’s alabama rolling gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Opelika Okey Dokey. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Opelika Okey Dokey when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Opelika Okey Dokey’s alabama rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Opelika Okey Dokey — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Opelika Okey Dokey — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Every session at Opelika Okey Dokey intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Opelika Okey Dokey’s alabama rolling gravel delivers on race day.
The varied gradients at Opelika Okey Dokey reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Opelika Okey Dokey’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Opelika Okey Dokey requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on alabama rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: rolling gravel, rural alabama, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 75 miles of alabama rolling gravel in Opelika, Alabama.
